diff_analysis.evidence: The newly added util.setPath, util.getPath, and util.deletePath functions allow arbitrary property paths (keys array) to be followed and modified on any provided object without guarding against special keys like '__proto__', 'constructor', or 'prototype'. If untrusted input is used for keys, this enables prototype pollution (CWE-1321), as the code will create or overwrite nested properties including those on Object.prototype.
